026package com.ibm.streams.operator.control.patterns;
027
028import java.util.HashMap;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
031
032import javax.management.Notification;
033import javax.management.NotificationListener;
034import javax.management.ObjectName;
035
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamSchema;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.Type;
041import com.ibm.streams.operator.types.RString;
042import com.ibm.streams.operator.types.Timestamp;
043
044/**
045 * Notification listener that submits a tuple to an output port
046 * with the attributes set from the {@code Notification}.
047 * This provides a mechanism to convert notifications from the
048 * Job Control Plane (or any JMX MBean) to tuples for stream processing.
049 * <P>
050 * The tuple is sent asynchronously so that any tuple processing
051 * does not block notification handling. This also means that
052 * tuples may be submitted in a different order to their notification order.
053 * </P>
054 * <P>
055 * The tuple may have any number of attributes, and attributes not
056 * set from the notification are set to their default value.
057 * <BR>
058 * If attribute matches one of these, then it is set from the {@code Notification}:
059 * <UL>
060 * <LI>{@code rstring source} - The value of {@code ObjectName.getCanonicalName()} for the value returned by {@code getSource()}.</LI>
061 * <LI>{@code rstring notifyType} - The value of {@code getType()}.</LI>
062 * <LI>{@code int64 sequence} - The value of {@code getSequenceNumber()}.</LI>
063 * <LI>{@code timestamp ts} - The value of {@code getTimeStamp()} with machine identifier set to
064 * {@link Timestamp#DEFAULT_MACHINE}.</LI>
065 * <LI>{@code rstring message} - The value of {@code getMessage()}, if it is not null.</LI>
066 * <LI>{@code rstring userDataString} - The value of {@code getUserData().toString()}, if {@code getUserData()} is not {@code null}.</LI>
067 * <LI>{@code userData} - The value of {@code getUserData()}, note the SPL type of {@code userData} attribute must be directly assignable
068 * from the object type returned by {@code getUserData()}.</LI>
069 * <LI>{@code handback} - The value of {@code handback} set when this was added as a notification handler, note the SPL type of {@code handback} attribute must be directly assignable
070 * from the object type of {@code handback}.</LI>
071 * </UL>
072 * {@code rstring} values are assigned from {@code String} objects using UTF-8 encoding.
073 * </P>
074 *
075 */
076public class NotificationTupleSubmitter implements NotificationListener {
077    
078    /**
079     * Base schema that includes all the fixed typed attributes that
080     * can be set from a {@code Notification}, namely
081     * {@code source}, {@code notifyType}, {@code sequence}, {@code ts} and {@code message}.
082     */
083    public static final StreamSchema BASE_NOTIFY_SCHEMA = Type.Factory.getStreamSchema(
084            "tuple<rstring source, rstring notifyType, int64 sequence, timestamp ts, rstring message>");
085
086    private final OperatorContext context;
087    private final StreamingOutput<?> port;
088
089    /**
090     * Create a {@code NotificationTupleSubmitter}
091     * @param context Operator context for the operator containing the output port.
092     * @param port The output port to submit tuples to.
093     */
094    public NotificationTupleSubmitter(OperatorContext context, final StreamingOutput<?> port) {
095        this.context = context;
096        this.port = port;
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Handle the notification by converting {@code notification} and {code handback}
101     * to a tuple using {@link #getTuple(Notification, Object)} and then calling
102     * {@link #submit(Tuple)}.
103     */
104    @Override
105    public void handleNotification(final Notification notification, final Object handback) {       
106        final Tuple tuple = getTuple(notification, handback);
107        submit(tuple);
108    }
109    
110    /**
111     * Asynchronously submit the tuple to the output port.
112     * @param tuple Tuple to be submitted.
113     */
114    protected void submit(final Tuple tuple) {
115        context.getScheduledExecutorService().submit(new Callable<Object>() {
116            @Override
117            public Object call() throws Exception {
118                return port.submit(tuple);
119            }
120        });        
121    }
122    
123    /**
124     * Convert the notification to a tuple, using {@link #getAttributes(Notification, Object)}.
125     * @param notification Notification object.
126     * @param handback Handback object.
127     * @return Tuple to be submitted.
128     */
129    protected Tuple getTuple(final Notification notification, final Object handback) {
130        return port.getStreamSchema().getTuple(getAttributes(notification, handback));
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Convert the notification to a {@code Map} of attributes keyed by attribute name.
135     * @param notification Notification object.
136     * @param handback Handback object.
137     * @return Map containing attributes
138     */
139    protected Map<String, Object> getAttributes(final Notification notification, final Object handback) {
140        final Map<String, Object> attributes = new HashMap<String, Object>();
141
142        Object source = notification.getSource();
143        String ssource;
144        if (source instanceof ObjectName)
145            ssource = ((ObjectName) source).getCanonicalName();
146        else
147            ssource = source.toString();
148        attributes.put("source", new RString(ssource));
149        attributes.put("notifyType", new RString(notification.getType()));
150        attributes.put("sequence", notification.getSequenceNumber());
151        attributes.put("ts",
152                Timestamp.getTimestamp(notification.getTimeStamp()));
153        final Object userData = notification.getUserData();
154        if (userData != null) {
155            attributes.put("userData", userData);
156            attributes.put("userDataString", new RString(userData.toString()));
157        }
158        if (handback != null)
159            attributes.put("handback", handback);
160        if (notification.getMessage() != null)
161            attributes.put("message", new RString(notification.getMessage()));
162        return attributes;
163    }
164}
